How do I add a single-signature address to my wallet using the `addmultisigaddress` command?

The `addmultisigaddress` command is actually used to add a multisignature address to the wallet, not a single-signature address. It requires at least two keys or addresses to be specified, along with the number of required signatures. If you want to add a single-signature address, you would use a different command.

addmultisigaddress nrequired ["key",...] ( "account" )

Add a nrequired-to-sign multisignature address to the wallet.
Each key is a VRSC address or hex-encoded public key.
If 'account' is specified (DEPRECATED), assign address to that account.

Arguments:
1. nrequired    (numeric, required) The number of required signatures out of the n keys or addresses.
2. "keysobject"  (string, required) A json array of VRSC addresses or hex-encoded public keys
   [
    "address" (string) VRSC address or hex-encoded public key
    ...,
   ]
3. "account"   (string, optional) DEPRECATED. If provided, MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.

Result:
"VRSC_address" (string) A VRSC address associated with the keys.

Examples:

Add a multisig address from 2 addresses
> verus addmultisigaddress 2 "["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV","RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV"]"

As json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "addmultisigaddress", "params": [2, "["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV","RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV"]"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What is the purpose of the "account" argument in the `addmultisigaddress` command?

The "account" argument in the `addmultisigaddress` command is actually deprecated and should not be used. If provided, it must be set to an empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.

addmultisigaddress nrequired ["key",...] ( "account" )

Add a nrequired-to-sign multisignature address to the wallet.
Each key is a VRSC address or hex-encoded public key.
If 'account' is specified (DEPRECATED), assign address to that account.

Arguments:
1. nrequired    (numeric, required) The number of required signatures out of the n keys or addresses.
2. "keysobject"  (string, required) A json array of VRSC addresses or hex-encoded public keys
   [
    "address" (string) VRSC address or hex-encoded public key
    ...,
   ]
3. "account"   (string, optional) DEPRECATED. If provided, MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.

Result:
"VRSC_address" (string) A VRSC address associated with the keys.

Examples:

Add a multisig address from 2 addresses
> verus addmultisigaddress 2 "["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV","RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV"]"

As json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "addmultisigaddress", "params": [2, "["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV","RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV"]"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
Can I use the `addmultisigaddress` command to add a multisignature address with a variable number of required signatures?

No, the `addmultisigaddress` command requires a fixed number of required signatures, specified by the `nrequired` argument. This number must be specified when creating the multisignature address and cannot be changed later.

addmultisigaddress nrequired ["key",...] ( "account" )

Add a nrequired-to-sign multisignature address to the wallet.
Each key is a VRSC address or hex-encoded public key.
If 'account' is specified (DEPRECATED), assign address to that account.

Arguments:
1. nrequired    (numeric, required) The number of required signatures out of the n keys or addresses.
2. "keysobject"  (string, required) A json array of VRSC addresses or hex-encoded public keys
   [
    "address" (string) VRSC address or hex-encoded public key
    ...,
   ]
3. "account"   (string, optional) DEPRECATED. If provided, MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.

Result:
"VRSC_address" (string) A VRSC address associated with the keys.

Examples:

Add a multisig address from 2 addresses
> verus addmultisigaddress 2 "["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV","RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV"]"

As json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "addmultisigaddress", "params": [2, "["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV","RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV"]"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
